metadata.title: CVE-2023-34256 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.3.There is an out-of-bounds read in crc16 in lib/crc16.c when called fromfs/ext4/super.c because ext4_group_desc_csum does not properly check anoffset. NOTE: this is disputed by third parties because the kernel is notintended to defend against attackers with the stated "When modifying theblock device while it is mounted by the filesystem" access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-34256` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-5.15.0-83-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic - 5.15.0-83.92
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-83-generic-64k - 5.15.0-83.92
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-83.92').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1041.46').
